arm_group.arm_group_label: patients suspected of having lung cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to gain insight in the distress experience and quality of life
      of patients suspected of having a serious lung disease during the diagnostic phase and the
      period between diagnosis and start of treatment

clinical_study.brief_title: Distress and Quality of Life During the Diagnostic Phase of a Suspected Serious Lung Disease

detailed_description.textblock:
A life-threatening disease often leads to distress, an emotional experience that can
      interfere with coping. Studies in lung cancer patients show high prevalence of distress
      during the course of the disease. However until now, very few research was done during the
      diagnostic workup. This prospective study will describe and explore distress, quality of
      life and illness perception in lung cancer patients during the diagnostic period until first
      follow-up visit 4 weeks after start of therapy. Patient reported questionnaires will be
      used.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ambulatory patient

          -  imaging suggestive of lung cancer

          -  written informed consent

          -  able to complete questionnaires

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  solitary pulmonary nodule

          -  previous diagnosis of cancer

study_pop.textblock: patients with abnormal imaging suggestive of lung cancer consulting a pulmonologist

intervention.arm_group_label: patients suspected of having lung cancer
intervention.intervention_name: observational study: use of patient questionnaires

clinical_study.official_title: How Burdensome is the Diagnostic Phase ? Distress and Quality of Life in Patients Suspected of Having a (Serious) Lung Disease

primary_outcome.time_frame: at time of suspected lung cancer, at time of diagnosis, at time of treatment start, 4 weeks after treatment start

primary_outcome.description: patient reported questionnaire (EORTC QLQ-C30 + lung cancer module)
primary_outcome.measure: longitudinal assessment of quality of life
primary_outcome.time_frame: at time of suspected lung cancer, at time of diagnosis, at time of treatment start, 4 weeks after treatment start
at time of suspected lung cancer, at time of diagnosis, at time of treatment start, 4 weeks after treatment start

primary_outcome.measure: duration of diagnostic phase and period between diagnosis and treatment start
primary_outcome.time_frame: date of suspected lung cancer, date communication of diagnosis, date of treatment start

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Study Coordinator Thoracale Oncologie Groep Antwerpen

secondary_outcome.description: potential associated factors include patient demographic characteristics, performed diagnostic procedures, disease and treatment characteristics
secondary_outcome.measure: explore which factors are associated with distress, quality of life and illness perception
secondary_outcome.time_frame: first visit suspected lung cancer, communication of diagnosis, treatment start, 4 weeks after treatment start

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
